Ghanerao is a village in Desuri tehsil of Pali district of Rajasthan. 
 
 The village is located on the Sadri-Desuri road State Highway 16 and 35Km from Falna railway station. Due to its proximity to Kumbhalgarh fort, Ranakpur Jain temple and Kumbhalgarh Wildlife Sanctuary, it is an important place in tourism with history. There are many Hindu and Jain temples in and around Ghanerao. There are about 11 Jain temples some of them are quite old, Muchhal Mahavir Temple being the most notable one. In the village are also Hindu temples of Laxmi Narayanji, Murlidhar and Charbhujaji. On the outskirts of the village is situated a ‘mahanth’ known as Giriji Ki Dhani. The village have a many temples of Riddhi and Siddhi Gajanand, a Sri Mahalaxmi ji, Sri Britwaser Mahadev Temple {Sri Bohra Shrimali Brahmins} 
 
 Ghanerao was a princely thikana of 37 villages founded in 1606. It was a member of two states Jodhpur State as well as Udaipur State. It was ruled by Rathores of Mertia clan. The village has a fort which is now a heritage hotel 
 
 Notable places
 -------------------------------------------------------------
 • Ghanerao Castle
 • Mahavira Jain temple,constructed around 1020 CE
 • Ghanerao Jungle Lodge (Bagha Ka Bagh)
 • Sri Shrimali Brahmins Mahalaxmi Tempal Ghanerao
 • Sri Britwaser Mahadev (Lord Shive Ji)Temple {Sri Bohra Shrimali Brahmins}

This is the place where more than 100 years old Shree Chintamani Parasnathji’s new temple has been built and there was a huge celebration (Prathistha) and since then it’s been one of the place own for its love and affection for any festival and celebration in the village. Shree Jasrajji Singhvi of Ghanerao has played big role in setting up a meeting of Varkana Mahasabha between 99 villages named as Jhajam. This place is known for its historical 11 Magical Jain temple. 
 
 In Ghanerao there are around 700 homes of Oswal families and 150 homes of Porval families. The 14th – 15th generation of Shree Dharansha family, inaugurator of Shree Ranakpur temple leaves in Ghanerao. Management of Soda Trith is taken care by Ghanerao Trust. 
 
 Temples in Ghanerao:
 1. Shree Adheswarji Jain Temple
 2. Shree Kunthunathji Jain Temple
 3. Shree Godhi Paraswanathji Jain Temple
 4. Shree Jirawala Paraswanathji Jain Temple
 5. Shree Chintamani Paraswanathji Jain Temple
 6. Shree Munisuvarath Jain Temple
 7. Shree Abhinandan Jain Temple
 8. Shree Kesarriyaji Jain Temple
 9. Shree Dharmanathji Jain Temple
 10. Shree Chomukha Paraswanathji Jain Gyan Temple
 11. Shree Nava Nakoda – Kirthistambh Jain Temple
 12. Shree Adheswar dada Ghar Temple
 13. Shree Himachalsuriji Jain Dadavadi 
 
 Places at Ghanerao
 1. Ghanerao – Ravala
 2. Ridhi Sidhi Gajbadhan Temple
 3. Historical and Legendary Heritage 
 
 Location:
 10 KM from Sadri-Char bhuja main road
 7 KM from Desuri, 25 KM from Nadol, 20 KM from Ranakpur and 6 KM from Muchala Mahavir
 
 All public transportation is available, nearest railway station is Falna at 36 KM and airport is Udaipur at 110 KM. 
 
 Facilities:
 2 Floors Dharamshala next to Chintamani Parasvanath Jain Temple having 28 rooms and 5 Big Rooms also it is having Bhojanshala. Also there is bed, pillow and blankets for 500 people. Apart from this there is another Dharamshala Kirtistambh having 15 rooms and 2 big rooms with Bhojanshala and very big hall for any program or vaykhyan. 
 
 Trust:
 Shree Adhinath Bhagwan Pedi
 Main Bazar PO Ghanerao – 306704
 Tahsil – Desuri, District – Pali, Rajasthan
 President: Shree Kanakrajji Lodha – 09820258931
 Tel: 02934-284022
 Munimji – Shree Ratanji – 09414814453

Shree Muchala Mahavir Social Group was founded in the year of 1990 by Shree ABC comprising of total 11 members. With the support of all the committee members this trust is flourishing and getting on the new highs.
